Shit servers. All the shit people from other communities are here to flame you. You need to spend many hours to learn how to play and all that progress can go to waste if you ever decide to take a break. People here don't have a life so expect huge amount of bullshit knowledge from the other team. Aiming is very dumb and tactics will probably take a lot of time to learn through guides.

Overall a waste of time which I could've spent playing other stuff, almost everything is more interesting than CS.

The game itself is very good, players can improve endlessly. It is both technical and tactical, so that players may play in different but complementary ways.
However, the biggest problem is that CS:GO is not welcoming [i]at all[/i] for beginners. Tutorial is almost non-existent. Certain core mechanics are never mentioned (like spray patterns, how could a newbie know that their gun may not actually shoot where they are aiming at?). Matchmaking pits new accounts against medium-level players instead of other beginners. And finally the community is usually elitist and toxic (but I suppose most online games are like that).
I recommend to play CS:GO only if you find some nice and motivated friends to play with, or if you are [strike]mentally strong[/strike] stubborn enough to endure the harsh life of a CS:GO beginner until you start knowing what you are doing. Also, YouTube is your friend to learn how to play.
